name: 視覺效果與影像處理
description: This course will take as its starting point the placing (installation) of video and photography within physical spaces of display and exhibition, from conventional galleries to internal and external sites replete with history and meaning.  The multiple and complex reading such installations produce will be examined by focussing on individual artists, specific concepts, techniques and methods of approach.  There will be visits to exhibitions and to sites, this latter with the aim of proposing ways of utilising the city and its spaces in conjunction with video and photographic imagery.  During the course students will work on proposals, and one of these will be realised at the end of the course as the final assessment.
goals: To introduce students to concepts of site, context, display, and the presence and interaction of the viewer.
To widen the understanding of the interrelationship of site and context to video and photographic imagery
To examine the preceding in the context of contemporary and twentieth century art practice
To work towards an exhibition of students personal video and photographic projects that addresses site, installation and viewer
syllabus:
1        Introduction: Course outline and central ideas.

2        Installation, an overview with reference to video and photography

3        Site, context, the viewer in relation to video and photography

4        Student presentations of own practice and ideas

5        Video, photography, and the use of space

6        Time and narrative

7        Light and display

8        Group discussion and presentation of ideas towards final presentation

9        Artists focus:  Oursler, Egoyan (Steenbecket)

10    Artists focus:  Marker, Greenaway

11    Artists focus: video and photography as record of event. (Long, Fulton, Orozco)

12    Artists focus: video sculpture (Nam Jun Paik, Gary Hill)

13    Artists focus: student presentation on artists

14    External site, possibilities inherent in site-specific work (group discussion, exploration)

15     Memory

16    Individual tutorials (final presentation)

17    Exhibition visit (exact schedule dependant on availability)

18    Final presentation

(schedule will be flexible dependent on student numbers and to allow for exhibition visits etc)

methodologies.note: Lectures will be informal, illustrated, and focus on artists, concepts, and methods of addressing context and site
After lectures (or during lectures), and as course progresses will become important method of examining ideas
Studio work will be presented and discussed during the lessons.  It is expected that students will work on self-directed projects in their own time towards realization as final presentation
Visits to exhibitions and sites (identified in discussion)
Visual images (pp) will accompany all lectures. Texts of lectures will be provided for students. When appropriate video will accompany lectures.  Projector will be required

grading.note: individual discussion via email will also be accepted
Comprises presentation of ideas towards final presentation (installation proposals) and presentation/focus on student choice of artist.
Final presentation (either as realized installation or fully developed proposal for installation)
